qas.question: When was the height of colonization?

context: As god of colonization, <a0_0>Apollo<a0_0/> gave oracular guidance on colonies, especially during the height of colonization, <a1_0>750–550 BCE<a1_0/>. According to Greek tradition, he helped Cretan or Arcadian colonists found the city of Troy. However, this story may reflect a cultural influence which had the reverse direction: Hittite cuneiform texts mention a Minor Asian god called Appaliunas or Apalunas in connection with the city of Wilusa attested in Hittite inscriptions, which is now generally regarded as being identical with the Greek Ilion by most scholars. In this interpretation, Apollo's title of Lykegenes can simply be read as "<a2_0>born in Lycia<a2_0/>", which effectively severs the god's supposed link with wolves (possibly a folk etymology).
